citation.article-title: Pedobacter composti sp. nov., isolated from compost.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pedobacter composti sp. nov.
Pedobacter composti (com.pos′ti. N.L. gen. n. composti of compost).
Cells are Gram-negative, strictly aerobic, non-motile and 0.2–0.3×1.2–1.6 μm after cultivation for 4 days on R2A agar.
Colonies grown on R2A agar (Difco) for 3 days are smooth, circular, convex and pale orange in colour.
Good growth occurs at 30 °C and pH 7.0.
Growth is observed at 15–37 °C, at pH 5.0–8.0 and in 0–1 % (w/v) NaCl.
Substrate utilization, enzyme production and other physiological characteristics are indicated in Table 1.
In addition, utilizes l-arabinose, glucose, maltose, mannose, N-acetylglucosamine and salicin as sole carbon sources.

Does not utilize acetate, adipate, l-alanine, caprate, citrate, l-fucose, gluconate, glycogen, l-histidine, 3- or 4-hydroxybenzoate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, inositol, itaconate, 2- or 5-ketogluconate, lactate, malate, malonate, mannitol, melibiose, phenylacetate, l-proline, propionate, rhamnose, ribose, l-serine, sorbitol, suberate, sucrose or valerate as sole carbon sources.

In API 50CH tests, acid is produced only from aesculin; acid is not produced from N-acetylglucosamine, adonitol, amygdalin, d- or l-arabinose, d- or l-arabitol, arbutin, cellobiose, dulcitol, erythritol, d- or l-fucose, fructose, galactose, gentiobiose, glucose, gluconate, glycerol, glycogen, inositol, inulin, 2- or 5-ketogluconate, lactose, d-lyxose, maltose, mannitol, mannose, melibiose, melezitose, methyl α-d-glucoside, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl β-d-xyloside, raffinose, rhamnose, ribose, salicin, sorbitol, sorbose, starch, sucrose, d-tagatose, trehalose, turanose or d- or l-xylose.

According to the API ZYM gallery, positive for acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, cystine arylamidase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, valine arylamidase, β-galactosidase and β-glucosidase, weakly positive for α-glucosidase, and tests negative for lipase (C14), naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, α-mannosidase and β-glucuronidase.
The major fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH, C16 : 1ω7c and anteiso-C15 : 0.
Other phenotypic characteristics are given in Table 1.
The type strain, TR6-06T (=KCTC 12638T=LMG 23490T), was isolated from compost near Daejeon city, South Korea.
The genomic DNA G+C content of the type strain is 41.9 mol%.
